## News Review for epson

# Epson News Review

## Executive Summary

Epson demonstrated market presence across multiple business segments during late October through early November 2024, with retail partnerships driving consumer printer visibility through promotional campaigns at Target and Sam's Club featuring the EcoTank ET-2800 at $199.99 and ET-2400 at $159 respectively ([Southern Savers Target](https://www.southernsavers.com/target-weekly-ad-112-118-2/) and [Sam's Club](https://www.southernsavers.com/sams-club-instant-savings-deals-1029-1130/)). The company maintained strategic positioning in the Australian printer market, identified as one of ten key players in a sector projected to grow from $1 billion to $1.50 billion by 2033 ([Globe Newswire Australia Market](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/31/3178290/28124/en/Australia-Printer-Market-Size-and-Trends-2025-2033-Featuring-Strategic-Analysis-of-Key-Players-Canon-FUJIFILM-Fujitsu-Hitachi-Honeywell-International-HP-Panasonic-Seiko-Epson-Toshi.html)). Epson expanded beyond traditional printing through photography community engagement as main sponsor of the 2025 International Pano Awards, with MD Craig Heckenberg connecting panoramic photography trends to the company's wide-format printer capabilities ([PetaPixel](https://petapixel.com/2025/10/28/2025-international-pano-awards/)). The company also appeared in emerging technology markets, listed among mobile augmented reality market players in a sector valued at $29.2 billion ([Globe Newswire AR Market](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/28/3175180/0/en/Mobile-Augmented-Reality-Market-Size-to-Surpass-USD-327-7-Billion-by-2032-Rising-at-a-CAGR-of-30-84-Report-by-SNS-Insider.html)), while Chief Information & Digital Officer Michael Wang received recognition through the Global ORBIE award for technology leadership ([Globe Newswire ORBIE](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/24/3173119/0/en/Top-Technology-and-Security-Executives-Recognized-at-the-2025-SoCal-ORBIE-Awards.html)).

## Key Developments

**Product Positioning and Retail Partnerships**: Epson secured promotional placement for EcoTank printers across major retail channels, with the ET-2800 featured in Target's weekly ad at $199.99 and the ET-2400 Special Edition offered through Sam's Club at $159 after a $30 discount, including a bonus black ink bottle.

**Market Recognition**: The company was identified as one of ten key players in Australia's printer market, competing alongside Canon, HP, and Xerox in a sector experiencing 4.58% compound annual growth rate through 2033.

**Photography Community Engagement**: Epson Australia and Southeast Asia served as main sponsors for the 2025 International Pano Awards, awarding the Epson Digital Art Prize to Spanish photographer Daniel Viñé while promoting wide-format printing capabilities.

**Technology Leadership Recognition**: Michael Wang, Chief Information & Digital Officer at Epson America, received the Global ORBIE award recognizing technology executives at organizations with over $1.2 billion annual revenue.

**Emerging Technology Presence**: Seiko Epson Corporation appeared among 20 leading players in the mobile augmented reality market, suggesting diversification beyond traditional printing and projection technologies.

## Market Context

Epson operates within a competitive landscape where traditional printing manufacturers face pressure from both established competitors and innovative startups. The Australian market analysis positions the company in a growing sector driven by government digital transformation initiatives and increasing demand for personalized printing services, though supply chain disruptions affecting electronic components present challenges across the industry. In the projection market, Epson's high-brightness projectors like the QL7000 maintain cost advantages over premium micro-LED displays, with the $32,999 projector offering 10,000-lumen brightness compared to $200,000+ micro-LED alternatives. The company's inclusion in mobile AR market analysis indicates potential expansion into emerging technology segments beyond its core printing and projection business.

## Notable Quotes

Craig Heckenberg, Managing Director of Epson Australia, commented on panoramic photography trends: "The Pano Awards entries are always exceptional and this year the creativity has truly been taken to the next level. It's great to see so many more wide and ultra-wide panoramic shots this year, a format close to our hearts, as they are able to be truly and properly represented by Epson wide-format photo printers." ([PetaPixel](https://petapixel.com/2025/10/28/2025-international-pano-awards/))

## Strategic Implications

Epson's developments indicate a multi-pronged strategy combining consumer market penetration through retail partnerships, professional market engagement via photography community sponsorship, and potential diversification into emerging technologies like augmented reality. The company's positioning in the Australian market alongside major competitors suggests stable market presence, while retail promotional activities demonstrate focus on the cartridge-free EcoTank technology as a key differentiator. Recognition of technology leadership through the ORBIE award reinforces Epson America's digital transformation capabilities, while the photography sponsorship creates targeted marketing opportunities for wide-format printing solutions. The inclusion in mobile AR market analysis suggests Epson may be developing technologies beyond traditional printing and projection, potentially leveraging display or optical expertise for next-generation applications.

### Article 1: Target Weekly Ad: 11/2-11/8

## Summary

Target's weekly ad for November 2-8 features the Epson EcoTank ET-2800 Wireless all-in-one cartridge-free printer at $199.99, providing retail visibility for Epson's cartridge-free printing technology through a major retailer's promotional channels.

### Article 3: Australia Printer Market Size and Trends (2025-2033) Featuring Strategic Analysis of Key Players - Canon, FUJIFILM, Fujitsu, Hitachi, Honeywell International, HP, Panasonic, Seiko Epson, Toshiba, Xerox

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/31/3178290/28124/en/Australia-Printer-Market-Size-and-Trends-2025-2033-Featuring-Strategic-Analysis-of-Key-Players-Canon-FUJIFILM-Fujitsu-Hitachi-Honeywell-International-HP-Panasonic-Seiko-Epson-Toshi.html)

## Summary

Seiko Epson is identified as one of ten key players in Australia's printer market, which is projected to grow from US$ 1 billion in 2024 to US$ 1.50 billion by 2033. The market analysis positions Epson alongside major competitors including Canon, HP, Xerox, and Fujitsu in a landscape driven by government digital transformation initiatives and increasing demand for personalized printing services. While the market presents growth opportunities through business investments in modern printing solutions, all vendors including Epson face challenges from supply chain disruptions affecting electronic components and the need for continuous technological innovation to remain competitive.



---

### Article 4: Sam’s Club Instant Savings Deals 10/29-11/30

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.southernsavers.com/sams-club-instant-savings-deals-1029-1130/)

## Summary

Epson's EcoTank ET-2400 Special Edition All-in-One Inkjet Printer is featured in Sam's Club's holiday instant savings promotion from October 29 through November 30, 2024, offering customers a $30 discount from the original $189 price point plus a bonus black ink bottle. The promotion positions Epson alongside other major electronics brands in the retailer's holiday campaign, demonstrating the company's consumer market presence during the competitive holiday shopping season.



---

### Article 5: The Breathtaking Winners of the 2025 International Pano Awards

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://petapixel.com/2025/10/28/2025-international-pano-awards/)

## Summary

Epson Australia and Southeast Asia sponsored the 2025 International Pano Awards photography competition, providing cash and hardware prizes while awarding the Epson Digital Art Prize to Spanish photographer Daniel Viñé. Epson Australia MD Craig Heckenberg highlighted the connection between the competition's ultra-wide panoramic photography trend and Epson's wide-format photo printer capabilities, positioning the company's printers as optimal for representing panoramic photography formats. The sponsorship represents a marketing initiative to engage the photography community and promote Epson's wide-format printing solutions in the specialized panoramic photography market.

## Executive Insights

**Craig Heckenberg, Epson Australia MD**

> "The Pano Awards entries are always exceptional and this year the creativity has truly been taken to the next level. It's great to see so many more wide and ultra-wide panoramic shots this year, a format close to our hearts, as they are able to be truly and properly represented by Epson wide-format photo printers."

*Context: Commenting on the 2025 Pano Awards competition results and photography trends*

*Significance: Connects Epson's wide-format printer capabilities to panoramic photography market demand*

### Article 6: Mobile Augmented Reality Market Size to Surpass USD 327.7 Billion by 2032, Rising at a CAGR of 30.84% | Report by SNS Insider

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/28/3175180/0/en/Mobile-Augmented-Reality-Market-Size-to-Surpass-USD-327-7-Billion-by-2032-Rising-at-a-CAGR-of-30-84-Report-by-SNS-Insider.html)

## Summary

Seiko Epson Corporation was listed among 20 leading players in the mobile augmented reality market according to an SNS Insider report valuing the market at $29.2 billion in 2024. The company appears alongside major technology firms including Apple, Google, Microsoft, and Samsung in a market projected to reach $327.7 billion by 2032 with a 30.84% compound annual growth rate. While the report provides no specific details about Epson's AR products or market positioning, the inclusion suggests the company has developed AR-related technologies or hardware components, representing a potential diversification from its traditional printing and projection business lines.

### Article 8: Top Technology and Security Executives Recognized at the 2025 SoCal ORBIE Awards

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/10/24/3173119/0/en/Top-Technology-and-Security-Executives-Recognized-at-the-2025-SoCal-ORBIE-Awards.html)

## Summary

Epson America's Chief Information & Digital Officer Michael Wang received the Global ORBIE award at the 2025 SoCal ORBIE Awards ceremony, recognizing his technology leadership at the multi-national organization with over $1.2 billion in annual revenue. The award, presented on October 24, 2025, highlights Epson America's digital transformation efforts and positions the company among leading technology-driven organizations in Southern California.



---

### Article 9: As a home theater purist, I wouldn’t get LG’s cinema-sized new micro-LED TV – here’s why a projector is a better choice

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.techradar.com/televisions/projectors/as-a-home-theater-purist-i-wouldnt-get-lgs-cinema-sized-new-micro-led-tv-heres-why-a-projector-is-a-better-choice)

## Summary

The Epson QL7000 projector received mention as a competitive alternative to LG's new $200,000+ micro-LED display, with the QL7000's 10,000-lumen brightness and 300-inch projection capability positioned at $32,999 for bright room sports viewing applications. This positioning demonstrates Epson's strategy in the high-brightness projector segment, where projection technology maintains cost advantages over premium micro-LED displays while delivering large-screen experiences for specific use cases.

### Article 10: Build 10/30: A Silly Pass at Logo Design

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://dsriseah.com/journal/2025/1024/)

## Summary

The article mentions an Epson DS-30 scanner that remained functional after being stored in a basement, requiring only driver installation and basic cleaning to resume operation for scanning pencil sketches. This represents a minor anecdotal reference to Epson's product durability rather than any business development or market positioning, appearing as a brief mention in a personal blog post about logo design rather than technology industry news.

### Article 11: The New Projector That’ll Make You Rethink Your TV

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.esquire.com/lifestyle/tech/a69112868/valerions-visionmaster-pro2-projector-review/)

## Summary

The article positions Epson as an established projector manufacturer with strong brand recognition but facing competitive pressure from innovative startups like Valerion, which successfully crowdfunded its VisionMaster Pro2 projector. While Epson maintains market presence alongside Sony in the traditional projector space, newer entrants are challenging established players by offering comparable 4K laser projection capabilities, smart TV features, and competitive pricing through alternative funding models, indicating the projector market is becoming more competitive with crowdfunded companies gaining traction.
